item.title: Ticket #412 (Editing posts causes custom field "enclosure" and pinging images) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I have the same problem, and changing an existing post (with an image in it) is very very slow.

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
I attached a patch to wp-blog-header.php that might help. It checks to see if SCRIPT_NAME is present in PATH_INFO. On most systems this should not happen; however, it's happening here and messing things up.

Try it with a regular query such as "/archives/2004/12/" and with a path info query such as "/index.php/archives/2004/12/". Hopefully both cases will work. If you still have troubles, provide the output of the following debug statement.

echo "SCRIPT_NAME: {$_SERVERSCRIPT_NAME?} <br/>\n";

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description:
Some of my users are experiencing this error too. If the 404 page is available in the theme, it's being used instead of any of the other pages and is_404() is always returned as true.

If any of the developers are unable to reproduce this behaviour, I could set up a temporary account in which you can set up a clean install of WP and investigate.

item.title: Ticket #510 (changing page parent from 'edit button' redirects wrong) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description:
When you give a page a new parent the page gets properly reassigned in the hierarchy, but you get an error when it tries to go back to the page. I think it's because it's trying to go back to the old url, instead of the new one.

Error message:

Not Found The requested URL ... was not found on this server.

Additionally, a 404 Not Found error was encountered while trying to use an ErrorDocument to handle the request.

item.title: Ticket #509 (admin themes) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: since you're adding theme support, i think it would be cool to have an admin theme switcher that just swapped between different css files. this would make it easy for plain-spoken users to change the look of their admin interface.

item.title: Ticket #508 (no 'theme' directory) created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: is there a reason to not include an empty theme directory?

item.title: Ticket #507 (Admin functions loaded after plugins) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: That's why we have is_plugin_page(), which is in functions.php. We will not load admin-functions.php before loading the plugins because plugins are loaded not just for the admin backend, but for the frontend of the weblog as well. Tagging admin-functions.php along will clutter the critical path.

item.title: Ticket #507 (Admin functions loaded after plugins) created
item.dc:creator: noderat
item.description:
The new functions to allow plugins to hook into the menu fail to work as stated because plugins are loaded fairly early on and are processed before admin-functions.php is included.

MooKitty proposed this solution for dealing with it in a plugin, but it should be fixed in Wordpress so that a nasty hack like this isn't required.

Adds the menu item if ( ! function_exists( 'add_location_menu' ) ) {

function add_location_menu() {

add_options_page(('Locations'), ('Edit Geo Info'), 5, 'lm.php');

}

} else {

$LM_is_loaded = TRUE;

} add_action('admin_menu', 'add_location_menu');

if ( $LM_is_loaded ) : ?> <div class="wrap"> <h2>Location Manager</h2>

</div> <?php endif; ?>

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: kopa
item.description:
